text: <@U0YQQRNU8> No,  I configured LedgerType as dev_mode instead. I'll sort when I have free time.  Thanks all the same.
<@U26PBUZRT> Thanks  for your kind help.
<@U26PBUZRT> Did you have the —genesis flag on the validator? Also did you run the client commands right when the validator was starting up?
Without the —genesis flag the validator is looking for peers instead of building blocks.

<@U1ZUSJHAA> : make sure to 'python setup.py build' in sawtooth-core/validator and look for extra .pyc files left around which can mask the package (for example, sawtooth-core/core/journal and sawtooth-core/core/gossip) should no longer exist as both were moved to valdiator/.  third, make sure to 'source /vagrant/guest-files/local-env.sh' to get the new PYTHONPATH.
<@U26PBUZRT>  could you give us the command you used to start the validator, and the config file for the validator? :slightly_smiling_face:

<@U26PBUZRT|kiko3333> uploaded a file: <https://hyperledgerproject.slack.com/files/kiko3333/F2E9J66S1/These_are_the_command__validator_and_mktclient.txt|These are the command, validator and mktclient> and commented: wich is the configuration file than watch the validator?

file.title: These are the command, validator and mktclient

initial_comment.comment: wich is the configuration file than watch the validator?

text: <@U26PBUZRT> you should also pass the flag —genesis if you are running one validator in development.
ok, with genesis flag it is working, thanks. Anyway, wich is the configuration file is reading for default?

attachments.fallback: [September 21st, 2016 6:39 PM] boydjohnson: <@U26PBUZRT> you should also pass the flag —genesis if you are running one validator in development.
attachments.text: <@U26PBUZRT> you should also pass the flag —genesis if you are running one validator in development.

text: no problem.
Anyway, wich is the configuration file is reading for default?  /.../project/sawtooth-core/docs/source/tutorial/txnvalidator.js
Checkout sawtooth-core/sawtooth/validator_config.py. There is a ValidatorDefaultConfig class that sets up some defaults.
It isn’t by default the tutorial/txnvalidator.js file, but that is one that you can specify, or you can make your own based on the sawtooth-core/validator/etc/txnvalidator.js.example file.
Yes, yes, I see the into the class validator_config.py. Would not be better the parameter into extern file config not into the class? O maybe not, I dont know, these are the parameter by default...
I think the thinking was a person shouldn’t have to have an external config file and still get some rational defaults.
<@U2EA6JJDP|cemunsal> has joined the channel

<@U1V9UML9E> I was looking at trying to interface with the mktplace via the JS library mentioned in sawtooth release v0.7 under sawtooth-core/clients/javascript/README.md Anyone specific I can get some help from in setting this up or get some more documentation for it?
shukla also mentioned to me his work relies on the marketplace interface. If someone can comment on the planned stability of that over the next few weeks I'm sure that would be helpful information.
<@U231ZGXDG> I will look into this.
<@U0VKPD6A2> +1
<@U1V9UML9E> thanks!
